intro: Forchhammeria haitiensis, commonly known as the Haitian orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to Haiti. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, intricate flower structure. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, with a complex arrangement of petals and sepals. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
